transportation.q1: How do I use public transportation in Korea?
transportation.a1: You can use T-money card for buses and subways. Download the KakaoMap or NaverMap app for navigation.
transportation.q2: How do I get a T-money card?
transportation.a2: You can purchase a T-money card at convenience stores, subway stations, or online. You can recharge it at any convenience store or subway station.
transportation.q3: What are the main transportation apps in Korea?
transportation.a3: KakaoMap and NaverMap are the most popular navigation apps. KakaoTaxi is commonly used for taxi services.

banking.q1: How do I open a bank account in Korea?
banking.a1: Visit a bank branch with your ARC (Alien Registration Card) and passport. Some banks may require additional documents.
banking.a2: KEB Hana Bank, Shinhan Bank, and Woori Bank have English services and are popular among foreigners.
banking.q3: How do I transfer money internationally?
banking.a3: You can use online banking or visit a branch. Some banks offer special international transfer services for foreigners.

telecom.q1: How do I get a Korean phone number?
telecom.a1: Visit a telecom provider (SKT, KT, or LG U+) with your ARC and passport. You can choose between prepaid and postpaid plans.
telecom.q2: What are the main telecom providers in Korea?
telecom.a2: The three major providers are SK Telecom (SKT), KT, and LG U+. They all offer various plans for foreigners.
telecom.q3: How do I get mobile internet service?
telecom.a3: You can get a SIM card with data plan from telecom providers or purchase a portable WiFi device.

healthcare.q1: How does healthcare work in Korea?
healthcare.a1: Korea has a National Health Insurance system. Foreigners with an ARC can enroll after staying for 6 months.
healthcare.q2: How do I find an English-speaking doctor?
healthcare.a2: Major hospitals have international clinics. You can also use the 1339 hotline for medical consultation in English.
healthcare.q3: What should I do in case of emergency?
healthcare.a3: Call 119 for emergencies. The operators can speak English. Keep your insurance card and important medical documents with you.

visa.q1: How do I extend my visa?
visa.a1: Visit the immigration office with required documents before your current visa expires. The process varies by visa type.
visa.q2: What documents do I need for visa extension?
visa.a2: Typically you need your passport, ARC, application form, proof of residence, and documents specific to your visa type.
visa.q3: How do I change my visa type?
visa.a3: Submit an application at the immigration office with required documents. Some changes may require leaving and re-entering Korea.

housing.q1: What types of housing are available in Korea?
housing.a1: Common options include officetels, apartments, villas, and goshiwons. Each has different contract types and deposit requirements.
housing.a2: Jeonse is a large deposit with no monthly rent, while wolse is a smaller deposit with monthly rent. Both require contracts.
housing.q3: How do I find housing in Korea?
housing.a3: You can use real estate apps (직방, 다방), visit real estate agencies, or check online communities for foreigners.
